item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship. (text of measure as introduced: CR S1313)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S1312-1313)

summary.text: Directs the Chief Counsel for Advocacy of the Small Business Administration (SBA) to study, and report to the congressional small business and judiciary committees on, the effects on the ability of small businesses to obtain patents that would result from changing from a first-to-invent to a first-to-file invention priority system under federal patent law.

bill.title: A bill to require a study and report by the Office of Advocacy of the Small Business Administration regarding the effects of proposed changes in patent law.

item.title: A bill to require a study and report by the Office of Advocacy of the Small Business Administration regarding the effects of proposed changes in patent law.
A bill to require a study and report by the Office of Advocacy of the Small Business Administration regarding the effects of proposed changes in patent law.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
